item.title: Taliban Jihadists attack Pak forces near Afghan border; Bid to free arrested terrorists
item.description: Pak forces gunned down seven jihadists of Tehreek-e-Taliban (TTP) in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KPK) region of Pakistan.TTP jihadists were killed after a gun battle with Pak’s counter terrorism dept (CTD) team. The gun battle took place in North Waziristan when CTD team was shifting detained TTP militants to Bannu. TTP jihadists ambushed the security squad & in the ensuing gun battle seven Pak Taliban militants were killed including 3 TTP inmates, while others escaped. Watch this video for more.
item.itunes:title: Taliban Jihadists attack Pak forces near Afghan border; Bid to free arrested terrorists

content:encoded.p: Pak forces gunned down seven jihadists of Tehreek-e-Taliban (TTP) in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KPK) region of Pakistan.TTP jihadists were killed after a gun battle with Pak’s counter terrorism dept (CTD) team. The gun battle took place in North Waziristan when CTD team was shifting detained TTP militants to Bannu. TTP jihadists ambushed the security squad & in the ensuing gun battle seven Pak Taliban militants were killed including 3 TTP inmates, while others escaped. Watch this video for more.

item.title: How BBC responded to Tax 'Survey' at its Delhi, Mumbai Offices I Latest Updates
item.description: The Income Tax Department carried out 'Survey Operations' at BBC's offices in Mumbai and Delhi. I-T department officials told PTI that the 'surveys' were related to allegations of tax evasion and transfer price irregularities. The department is looking at documents related to business operations of the company's India arm. The I-T Dept 'Surveys' come just weeks after the BBC aired a two-part documentary on the 2002 Gujarat riots and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The opposition launched an all-out attack at the Centre over searches at the BBC offices with the Congress calling it an undeclared emergency.
item.itunes:title: How BBC responded to Tax 'Survey' at its Delhi, Mumbai Offices I Latest Updates

content:encoded.p: The Income Tax Department carried out 'Survey Operations' at BBC's offices in Mumbai and Delhi. I-T department officials told PTI that the 'surveys' were related to allegations of tax evasion and transfer price irregularities. The department is looking at documents related to business operations of the company's India arm. The I-T Dept 'Surveys' come just weeks after the BBC aired a two-part documentary on the 2002 Gujarat riots and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The opposition launched an all-out attack at the Centre over searches at the BBC offices with the Congress calling it an undeclared emergency.

item.title: NATO nation's big claim over India's oil trade with Russia I Watch
item.description: Germany claims India is "making the most" of the West's sanctions on Russia. The German Chancellor’s foreign and security policy adviser, Jens Plotner, said that India is benefiting from the price cap on Russian oil imposed by the West. The statement comes just days after trade data reports revealed that Russia remained India's biggest oil supplier for the third consecutive month in January. 28% of India’s total crude oil imports in January reportedly came from Russia. The price cap—introduced by G7 nations along with the EU and Australia—came into effect on December 5 and bars countries from paying more than $60 a barrel for Russian oil. Meanwhile, India's love for discounted Russian oil is widening its trade deficit with Moscow, and the casualty is their much-touted rupee trade plan. Watch this report for full information.
item.itunes:title: NATO nation's big claim over India's oil trade with Russia I Watch

content:encoded.p: Germany claims India is "making the most" of the West's sanctions on Russia. The price cap—introduced by G7 nations along with the EU and Australia—came into effect on December 5 and bars countries from paying more than $60 a barrel for Russian oil. item.title: ‘Raw Material For Terrorism…’: Amit Shah justifies PFI Ban, lashes Congress
item.description: Home Minister Amit Shah justified the ban on Popular Front of India (PFI) in an interview with ANI. He said that the Modi government banned the organization rising above politics. “I believe that PFI was spreading conversion and radicalism. They were trying to prepare raw materials for terrorism. We have so many documents that verify that the activities being carried out by the PFI were not good for the unity of the country,” Shah said in the interview. He pointed out that he never said that the now-banned PFI and Congress party are the same. Watch this video for more.
item.itunes:title: ‘Raw Material For Terrorism…’: Amit Shah justifies PFI Ban, lashes Congress

content:encoded.p: Home Minister Amit Shah justified the ban on Popular Front of India (PFI) in an interview with ANI. He said that the Modi government banned the organization rising above politics. “I believe that PFI was spreading conversion and radicalism. They were trying to prepare raw materials for terrorism. We have so many documents that verify that the activities being carried out by the PFI were not good for the unity of the country,” Shah said in the interview. He pointed out that he never said that the now-banned PFI and Congress party are the same. Watch this video for more.

item.title: Amit Shah tears into Pak, critics of Art 370 abrogation; ‘Terrorism Decreasing’
item.description: Home Minister Amit Shah has once again taken critics head on over abrogation of Article 370. Talking about the 're-imagined history' of Jammu and Kashmir and the abrogation of Article 370, Home Minister Amit Shah said that Article 370 was included in the Constitution by Jawaharlal Nehru and caused a great loss to the country. He added that since the abrogation in 2019, Jammu and Kashmir has witnessed a decline in terrorism and terror-related activities and that the UT is on a path to development. The Home Minister also said restoration of statehood to J&K would come up after assembly polls and that a call on timing of elections will be taken by the Election Commission.
item.itunes:title: Amit Shah tears into Pak, critics of Art 370 abrogation; ‘Terrorism Decreasing’

content:encoded.p: Home Minister Amit Shah has once again taken critics head on over abrogation of Article 370. Talking about the 're-imagined history' of Jammu and Kashmir and the abrogation of Article 370, Home Minister Amit Shah said that Article 370 was included in the Constitution by Jawaharlal Nehru and caused a great loss to the country. He added that since the abrogation in 2019, Jammu and Kashmir has witnessed a decline in terrorism and terror-related activities and that the UT is on a path to development. The Home Minister also said restoration of statehood to J&K would come up after assembly polls and that a call on timing of elections will be taken by the Election Commission.

item.title: Hanuman controversy at Aero India 2023 | HAL removes pic from HLFT-42 aircraft
item.description: The Hindustan Aeronautics Limited removed a picture of Lord Hanuman from one of their aircraft at the Aero India 2023 following a controversy. HAL had showcased the full-scale model of its supersonic trainer aircraft HLFT-42 with a picture of Lord Hanuman on its tail. HAL earlier said they had decided to use Hanuman's picture to display the power of the aircraft, however the decision to remove it came after an internal discussion. Aero India 2023 is Asia's largest aero show and it was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The 5-day event will see participation of 809 companies and delegates from 98 countries.
item.itunes:title: Hanuman controversy at Aero India 2023 | HAL removes pic from HLFT-42 aircraft

HAL earlier said they had decided to use Hanuman's picture to display the power of the aircraft, however the decision to remove it came after an internal discussion. Aero India 2023 is Asia's largest aero show and it was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The 5-day event will see participation of 809 companies and delegates from 98 countries.

item.title: Amit Shah rejects 'erasing Mughal history' charge amid BJP's 'Lucknow as Laxmanpur' demand
item.description: Amit Shah, the Home Minister, responds sharply to allegations of erasing Mughal history. Responding to a question on the Mughal legacy, Shah said that the BJP does not want to remove anybody's contribution to history, including that of the Mughals. The Home Minister also defended the renaming spree in BJP-ruled states and said not a single city that previously did not have an old name has been changed. The statement comes just days after U.P. Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak appealed to change the name of Lucknow as it is "well known as the city of Laxman." After this, BJP MP Sangam Lal Gupta urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to rename U.P.'s capital city of Lucknow as "Lakhanpur" or "Laxmanpur."
item.itunes:title: Amit Shah rejects 'erasing Mughal history' charge amid BJP's 'Lucknow as Laxmanpur' demand

content:encoded.p: Amit Shah, the Home Minister, responds sharply to allegations of erasing Mughal history. Responding to a question on the Mughal legacy, Shah said that the BJP does not want to remove anybody's contribution to history, including that of the Mughals. The Home Minister also defended the renaming spree in BJP-ruled states and said not a single city that previously did not have an old name has been changed. The statement comes just days after U.P. Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak appealed to change the name of Lucknow as it is "well known as the city of Laxman." After this, BJP MP Sangam Lal Gupta urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to rename U.P.'s capital city of Lucknow as "Lakhanpur" or "Laxmanpur."

item.title: U.S ‘spy’ balloon saga a ploy? Sensational claim amid row over Nord Stream ‘sabotage’ | Details
item.description: Back-to-back UFO "dramas" have raised several questions over the claims made by the United States. Former U.S. NSA (National Security Agency) employee and whistleblower Edward Snowden says shot-down UFOs are meant to divert attention from Nord Stream sabotage. "The security panic is also engineered for political misdirection," claims Snowden. Seymour Hersh, an American journalist, published an article on February 8 detailing how the United States and Norway blew up Nord Stream pipelines transporting Russian natural gas to Germany in September. The investigative report on Nord Stream sabotage was denounced as false by the U.S. government. After this, over the next several days, the U.S. military began shooting down "objects" in the skies. While the first so-called "spy balloon" belonged to China, the U.S., which is now under fire, says it is not sure if the other three flying objects it downed were spying. Watch this report for more.
item.itunes:title: U.S ‘spy’ balloon saga a ploy? Sensational claim amid row over Nord Stream ‘sabotage’ | Details

content:encoded.p: Back-to-back UFO "dramas" have raised several questions over the claims made by the United States. Former U.S. NSA (National Security Agency) employee and whistleblower Edward Snowden says shot-down UFOs are meant to divert attention from Nord Stream sabotage. "The security panic is also engineered for political misdirection," claims Snowden. Seymour Hersh, an American journalist, published an article on February 8 detailing how the United States and Norway blew up Nord Stream pipelines transporting Russian natural gas to Germany in September. The investigative report on Nord Stream sabotage was denounced as false by the U.S. government. After this, over the next several days, the U.S. military began shooting down "objects" in the skies. While the first so-called "spy balloon" belonged to China, the U.S., which is now under fire, says it is not sure if the other three flying objects it downed were spying. Watch this report for more.

item.title: Lanka rejects LTTE Chief alive claim; 'Prabhakaran was killed. DNA proved it'
item.description: Sri Lanka has dismissed as joke the claims that LTTE Chief Prabhakaran was alive. Pazha Nedumaran, a noted nationalist leader in Tamil Nadu, said on February 13 that the leader of the LTTE 'is doing well and a conducive atmosphere prevails for him to appear now.' "It is confirmed that he was killed on 19 May 2009. The DNA has proved it," said Colonel Nalin Herath, Sri Lanka's defence ministry spokesperson. Watch this video for more information.
item.itunes:title: Lanka rejects LTTE Chief alive claim; 'Prabhakaran was killed. DNA proved it'

content:encoded.p: Sri Lanka has dismissed as joke the claims that LTTE Chief Prabhakaran was alive. Pazha Nedumaran, a noted nationalist leader in Tamil Nadu, said on February 13 that the leader of the LTTE 'is doing well and a conducive atmosphere prevails for him to appear now.' "It is confirmed that he was killed on 19 May 2009. The DNA has proved it," said Colonel Nalin Herath, Sri Lanka's defence ministry spokesperson. Watch this video for more information.

item.title: ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’ needs private sector, not bureaucracy, to soar
item.description: In spite of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s relentless efforts, the military-civilian bureaucracy is protecting its own fiefdom and is still sitting on allowing majority stake to private entities in a joint venture with defence PSUs.

item.title: ‘Treasure’: Sarojini Naidu’s 1928 speech in US gives Indians goosebumps | Viral
item.description: A 95-year-old video of Sarojini Naidu has now gone viral on social media. The video from her 1928 visit to the United States is giving goosebumps to netizens on her birth anniversary. The 55-second clip was shared by former Minister of Climate and the Environment of Norway, Erik Solheim, on Twitter. In the video, Naidu delivers a motivational speech about how, as a woman, she represents India in the 'new world.' The video has garnered over 1,81,000 views since it was shared. Watch the full video here.

item.title: Pak Goes Bankrupt: Chicken costs PKR 900, milk PKR 210 as inflation ‘crosses all limits’
item.description: Pakistan's dire economic state has hit its citizens hard with skyrocketing prices. Prices of daily-use items across Pakistan are on fire after the International Monetary Fund (IMF) sought more time to conclude a $1.1 billion loan tranche. People are struggling to put necessary food items on the table, such as milk and chicken, which are common principal items in Pakistani meals. The country's inflation is at a 48-year high, and foreign currency reserves cover less than a month of imports. Pakistanis say inflation has "crossed all limits," lamenting the IMF conditions. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has said that the Pakistani government would have to agree to IMF bailout conditions that are "beyond imagination." Watch this report for more.
item.itunes:title: Pak Goes Bankrupt: Chicken costs PKR 900, milk PKR 210 as inflation ‘crosses all limits’

content:encoded.p: Pakistan's dire economic state has hit its citizens hard with skyrocketing prices. Prices of daily-use items across Pakistan are on fire after the International Monetary Fund (IMF) sought more time to conclude a $1.1 billion loan tranche. People are struggling to put necessary food items on the table, such as milk and chicken, which are common principal items in Pakistani meals. The country's inflation is at a 48-year high, and foreign currency reserves cover less than a month of imports. Pakistanis say inflation has "crossed all limits," lamenting the IMF conditions. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has said that the Pakistani government would have to agree to IMF bailout conditions that are "beyond imagination." Watch this report for more.

item.title: Russia bombs Donetsk frontline with all might | How Ukrainian Resistance Broke
item.description: Russia has claimed that in the past 4 days its forces managed to shift the frontline 2 kms to the West amid bloody Ukraine war. Russian defence ministry has now released footage showing how Russian soldiers achieved the feat. Dramatic videos show how Russian soldiers detected Ukrainian strongholds along the frontline and bombed them in a bid to break the Ukrainian resistance. Watch this video to find out more about what is happening along the 1,500 km-long frontline as war anniversary nears.

item.title: Putin's new target days before invasion anniversary alarms NATO; Bakhmut's fall imminent | Watch
item.description: Days before the one-year anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Vladimir Putin's army has launched an all-new onslaught across the line of contact. The eastern Ukrainian city of Bakhmut is the centre of new bombardments. According to The New York Times, Kyiv has barred civilians from entering Bakhmut, which could be a precursor to a Ukrainian withdrawal from the city. Before February 24, the first anniversary of the invasion, Russia seems to have set a deadline to "liberate" the region that Putin annexed last October. Russia's ferocious launch of a new offensive has also alarmed NATO. Watch this video for full information.
item.itunes:title: Putin's new target days before invasion anniversary alarms NATO; Bakhmut's fall imminent | Watch

content:encoded.p: Days before the one-year anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Vladimir Putin's army has launched an all-new onslaught across the line of contact. The eastern Ukrainian city of Bakhmut is the centre of new bombardments. According to The New York Times, Kyiv has barred civilians from entering Bakhmut, which could be a precursor to a Ukrainian withdrawal from the city. Before February 24, the first anniversary of the invasion, Russia seems to have set a deadline to "liberate" the region that Putin annexed last October. Russia's ferocious launch of a new offensive has also alarmed NATO. Watch this video for full information.

item.title: Putin’s war drains UK arsenal? British Army flags ‘serious weapons shortage’ as Sunak arms Kyiv
item.description: The British military is reportedly stretched as Rishi Sunak mulls sending fighter jets to Ukraine. The Daily Mail reported that the British Army is having serious problems with ammunition shortages because of the amount of ammo and other ordnance being supplied to Ukraine. An unnamed source at the UK's Ministry of Defence told the newspaper that British forces are also stretched because of the extent to which they are training Ukrainian forces. Watch this video for more details.

item.title: FDA launches drive to keep a check on e-pharmacy operations

item.title: Kashmir’s Good Samaritans collect relief material for quake-hit Turkey, Syria
item.description: Omar Wani, a representative of the organisation, said the response of people was overwhelming. “Everybody saw videos of the earthquake and its aftermath which makes one’s heart cry. Within hours of our appeal, a flood of people came with blankets, sleeping bags etc. There was a traffic jam outside our office. We received three truckloads of material within a day and it is still continuing,” said Wani.
item.itunes:title: Kashmir’s Good Samaritans collect relief material for quake-hit Turkey, Syria

content:encoded.p: Omar Wani, a representative of the organisation, said the response of people was overwhelming. “Everybody saw videos of the earthquake and its aftermath which makes one’s heart cry. Within hours of our appeal, a flood of people came with blankets, sleeping bags etc. There was a traffic jam outside our office. We received three truckloads of material within a day and it is still continuing,” said Wani.

item.title: Lalitha Lajmi - A view into her soul
item.description: Her retrospective opened on 12th January, 2023, exactly a month before her death. It opened because she had dreamed of a befitting recognition for her contribution in Indian Art History as the only woman to have turned the gaze of the muse on herself. Until her, women had only been depicted as nude anatomical studies by male painters

item.title: Tiger kills two, including child, in Coorg
item.description: According to forest officers, the tiger attacked Chetan (12), the son of a migrant labourer at Churikadu in K Badaga village on Sunday at 4 pm. Chetan’s parents migrated from Panchavalli in Hunsur just three months back for a coffee estate owned by N Poonacha. The workers were in the estate when the tiger killed the boy, playing in front of the labourer’s quarters provided by the estate owner, officers added.
item.itunes:title: Tiger kills two, including child, in Coorg

content:encoded.p: According to forest officers, the tiger attacked Chetan (12), the son of a migrant labourer at Churikadu in K Badaga village on Sunday at 4 pm. Chetan’s parents migrated from Panchavalli in Hunsur just three months back for a coffee estate owned by N Poonacha. The workers were in the estate when the tiger killed the boy, playing in front of the labourer’s quarters provided by the estate owner, officers added.

item.description: The groups have formed a committee called ‘Salokha Samiti’ (harmony committee) to demand the withdrawal of the interfaith panel. item.title: NATO stockpiles in dire straits as Ukraine army needs outstrips production rate
item.description: NATO has said it will increase targets for stockpiling ammunition as Kyiv is burning through shells much faster than Western countries can produce them and after a year of conflict in Ukraine has left allied stocks badly depleted. The West needed to ramp up production, with the waiting time for large-calibre ammunition increasing to 28 months from 12 months, Stoltenberg said. Watch this video for more.
item.itunes:title: NATO stockpiles in dire straits as Ukraine army needs outstrips production rate

content:encoded.p: NATO has said it will increase targets for stockpiling ammunition as Kyiv is burning through shells much faster than Western countries can produce them and after a year of conflict in Ukraine has left allied stocks badly depleted. The West needed to ramp up production, with the waiting time for large-calibre ammunition increasing to 28 months from 12 months, Stoltenberg said. Watch this video for more.

item.title: Tamil Leader’s shocking claim about LTTE Chief Prabhakaran | ‘Alive &…' I Watch
item.description: A veteran former politician in Tamil Nadu Pazha Nedumaran has made a shocking claim. He says LTTE Chief Prabhakaran, who was declared dead by the Sri Lankan govt 14 years ago, is alive and healthy. Nedumaran says Prabhakaran will soon make a public appearance. Prabhakaran, the founder of Liberation of Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE), led an extensive guerrilla campaign for a separate homeland for Lankan Tamils in the island nation. He was declared dead on May 18, 2009 after an operation by the Sri Lankan army at Mullivaikal. Addressing a briefing, Pazha Nedumaran, the President of the Worlds Tamil Confederation, said 'LTTE chief Prabhakaran is alive and will appear soon. We are happy to announce this to the world. He would announce his plans for Tamil Eelam'.
item.itunes:title: Tamil Leader’s shocking claim about LTTE Chief Prabhakaran | ‘Alive &…' I Watch

content:encoded.p: A veteran former politician in Tamil Nadu Pazha Nedumaran has made a shocking claim. He says LTTE Chief Prabhakaran, who was declared dead by the Sri Lankan govt 14 years ago, is alive and healthy. Nedumaran says Prabhakaran will soon make a public appearance. Prabhakaran, the founder of Liberation of Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE), led an extensive guerrilla campaign for a separate homeland for Lankan Tamils in the island nation. He was declared dead on May 18, 2009 after an operation by the Sri Lankan army at Mullivaikal. Addressing a briefing, Pazha Nedumaran, the President of the Worlds Tamil Confederation, said 'LTTE chief Prabhakaran is alive and will appear soon. We are happy to announce this to the world. He would announce his plans for Tamil Eelam'.

item.title: NATO nation warns EU against escalating Putin’s war by sending arms to Ukraine
item.description: Hungary has yet again warned the European union against arming Ukraine. The foreign minister of the NATO nation claimed that continued weapons supply to Ukraine will only escalate the conflict with Russia. Speaking to radio Kossuth, Peter Szijjarto slammed the decisions of EU lawmakers on Ukraine and said that they have generally caused damage to Europe and further weapons deliveries will only worsen the hostilities. Watch this video for more information.

item.title: Israel’s Jerusalem ‘Revenge’; Netanyahu legalises nine more West Bank settlements
item.description: In a first such move by the Netanyahu cabinet, the Israeli government has authourised nine Jewish settlements in the West Bank which were previously unauthourised outposts. Israeli PM Netanyahu's office has called a decision a response to recent attacks in East Jerusalem. The move has drawn condemnation from the Palestinian Authority which called it an 'open war' against its people. Netanyahu's office said more housing units are likely to be built in separate, existing illegal settlements. The decision comes amid escalating Israeli-Palestinian violence, with at least 46 Palestinians killed so far this year.
item.itunes:title: Israel’s Jerusalem ‘Revenge’; Netanyahu legalises nine more West Bank settlements

Israeli PM Netanyahu's office has called a decision a response to recent attacks in East Jerusalem. Netanyahu's office said more housing units are likely to be built in separate, existing illegal settlements. The decision comes amid escalating Israeli-Palestinian violence, with at least 46 Palestinians killed so far this year.

item.title: China ‘exposes’ U.S., ‘spots' over 10 American ‘Spy’ balloons in airspace
item.description: China has now accused the U.S. of sending over 10 'spy' balloons in its airspace since 2022. The tensions between the two nations are at an all time high, after the U.S. shot down Chinese 'airship' earlier this month. China also added that the 'spy' balloon is not an uncommon phenomenon and that the U.S. should respond to its act. This comes at a time when U.S. shot down a fourth object in the North American airspace in the last 7 days and also at a time when China is preparing to shoot down an UFO over the Yellow Sea near Qingdao Port in Shandong province. Watch this video for more details.

item.title: Putin's 'Nazi' claims genuine? Zelensky shares soldier’s pic with skull insignia
item.description: An image shared by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky seems to prove Russian leader Vladimir Putin's Nazi claims about Kyiv's forces right. Ukrainian President Zelensky has posted a photo of a soldier sporting a symbol used by a notorious German unit that killed civilians in World War II. It is not the first time Ukrainian soldiers and paramilitaries have been photographed displaying insignia and tattoos associated with Nazism. The black-and-white skull-head patch on the soldier’s arm in the pic shared by Zelensky is similar to the "Totenkopf" insignia used by Adolf Hitler’s elite SS units. Notably, Ukraine's Azov Regiment, which is currently fighting Russians, is also well known for welcoming fighters with openly Nazi views. Remember, Russian President Vladimir Putin claims that "denazification" is one of the reasons Moscow launched a military operation in Ukraine. Watch this report for more.
item.itunes:title: Putin's 'Nazi' claims genuine? Zelensky shares soldier’s pic with skull insignia

The black-and-white skull-head patch on the soldier’s arm in the pic shared by Zelensky is similar to the "Totenkopf" insignia used by Adolf Hitler’s elite SS units. item.title: 'Can't break Russia': Putin's ally lambasts West; Rebukes partition plot
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally and Chechen Leader, Ramzan Kadyrov, rebukes Ukraine's stunning claims of "change on the Russian border soon." The Chechen leader said that "Russia's map can be redrawn only when Moscow decides." Ramzan Kadyrov said that such attempts to break Russia have been made by the West since the 1990s, but these overconfident people will fail. The Chechen warlord's remarks came after Alexey Danielov, Secretary of Ukraine's National Security and Defence Council, made claims about Russia's partition. Alexey Danielov said that "Russia is a colonial state that will soon split up." Watch this report for full information.

item.title: India 'receives' Russian arms worth $13 BN; Modi-Putin defence brotherhood stuns West | Details
item.description: Russia has "supplied India with around $13 billion of arms" during the past 5 years. According to Russian state news agencies, New Delhi has placed orders with Moscow for weapons and military equipment worth more than $10 billion. Notably, India is the world's biggest buyer of Russian arms, accounting for around 20% of Moscow's current weapons order book. Remember, New Delhi has not explicitly condemned Russia's invasion of Ukraine. India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi has called for dialogue and diplomacy to solve the Ukraine conflict but has refused to cut off ties with Moscow. Most western countries have imposed sanctions on Russia, including on its arms. Russia has praised India for not backing down in the face of western pressure. Watch this report for more.
item.itunes:title: India 'receives' Russian arms worth $13 BN; Modi-Putin defence brotherhood stuns West | Details

content:encoded.p: Russia has "supplied India with around $13 billion of arms" during the past 5 years. According to Russian state news agencies, New Delhi has placed orders with Moscow for weapons and military equipment worth more than $10 billion. Notably, India is the world's biggest buyer of Russian arms, accounting for around 20% of Moscow's current weapons order book. Remember, New Delhi has not explicitly condemned Russia's invasion of Ukraine. India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi has called for dialogue and diplomacy to solve the Ukraine conflict but has refused to cut off ties with Moscow. Most western countries have imposed sanctions on Russia, including on its arms. Russia has praised India for not backing down in the face of western pressure. Watch this report for more.

item.description: The Russian Defence Ministry has released dramatic footage of an armoured group of airborne combat vehicles BMD-2K-AU, BMPT Terminator and BTR-D with an anti-aircraft artillery installation ZU-23 opening non-stop fire at Ukrainian stronghold. item.title: Watch IAF war machine Prachand’s aerobatic display at Aero India 2023
item.description: Aero India 2023 witnessed thrilling aerobatics by made-in-India Light Combat Helicopter 'Prachand' which left the audience mesmerised. LCH 'Prachand' is the world's only attack helicopter suitable for flying at high altitudes. It has been designed and developed by Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd and was formally commissioned into the Indian Air Force in 2022. The multi-role attack helicopter can damage enemy's air defence activities and fire a variety of air-to-ground and air-to-air missiles.

It has been designed and developed by Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd and was formally commissioned into the Indian Air Force in 2022. item.title: 'Putin Can Win The War': NATO nation's big admission; Poland pushes for more arms to Ukraine
item.description: The NATO nation's leader makes a sensational statement on Russia's possible victory. Russia may win the Ukraine conflict if the Kyiv government does not receive more Western weapons in the coming weeks, according to Polish President Andrzej Duda. The Polish President clearly admitted during an interview that "Yes, Russia can win." The NATO leader's comments didn’t go unnoticed by the Russian government. Responding to the statement, the Russian Foreign Ministry said that even if western weapons are supplied to Kyiv quickly, they "won’t be able to change the outcome of the war." Watch this report for more information.

item.title: ‘Julie went & barked’: How India’s dog duo saved girl from Turkey quake rubble
item.description: On February 9, two Indian dogs were instrumental in saving the life of a 6-year-old girl, who was trapped inside the rubble in earthquake-ravaged Turkey. Four days after the miracle, dog handler Constable Kundan explains how Labrador Julie found the little girl, Beren, alive first in the rubble at the Nurdagi site. He added that Romeo and Julie succeeded where machines failed and said that without their help, the little girl could not have survived. Under 'Operation Dost,' India has sent a four-member dog squad to Turkey to help NDRF's search and rescue. Watch this video for more information.
item.itunes:title: ‘Julie went & barked’: How India’s dog duo saved girl from Turkey quake rubble

content:encoded.p: On February 9, two Indian dogs were instrumental in saving the life of a 6-year-old girl, who was trapped inside the rubble in earthquake-ravaged Turkey. Four days after the miracle, dog handler Constable Kundan explains how Labrador Julie found the little girl, Beren, alive first in the rubble at the Nurdagi site. He added that Romeo and Julie succeeded where machines failed and said that without their help, the little girl could not have survived. Under 'Operation Dost,' India has sent a four-member dog squad to Turkey to help NDRF's search and rescue. Watch this video for more information.

item.title: Russia breaks Ukrainian resistance; Putin’s men advance 2 KM West of frontline
item.description: Russian Army has succeeded in breaking the resistance of the Ukrainian soldiers at the frontline. News agency Interfax quoted Russian defence ministry to claim that the Army had advanced 2 km deeper and moved the frontline to the west. It however did not specify in which region the frontline had moved. A fierce fighting in underway in the Donetsk region as Russian Army aims to capture the entire eastern region in Ukraine. The Russian defence ministry also claimed that the troops had eliminated over 240 Ukrainian troops in the past day. It added that Ukraine was shelling Donetsk cities thrice in an hour and carried out over 40 attacks in the last 24 hours. Watch this video for more updates from the battleground.

item.title: Op Dost: Army-made fixators help Turkey quake survivors | Display At Aero India
item.description: Indian Army has become a beacon of hope for several earthquake survivors in Turkey and Syria. The Indian Army has set up a field hospital in Turkey's Hatay, where doctors have deployed light fixators that help treat fractures. These fixators weigh only five grams and cost ₹300 each. They are developed by the Indian Army and have been used by over 200 patients till now. Colonel Vijay Adarsh, the developer of this fixator displayed his product at the Aero India 2023 event in Bengaluru today. Watch this video for more information.

item.title: 'Pak, Dhokla & 2 AM Call': Ex-Army Officer on Shah’s final Srinagar visit before 370 move
item.description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah's visit to Srinagar in June 2019 was intended to "put the finishing touches" on the government's determination to repeal Article 370. Inside details of Amit Shah's 370 Purge Plan have been revealed by Lt. Gen. (R) KJS Dhillon in his yet-to-be-released book, "Kitne Ghazi Aaye, Kitne Ghazi Gaye." Lt. Gen. (R) KJS Dhillon said that a lot of sensitive issues and key points were on the table for discussion, apart from the delectable food that included aloo paratha and the famous Gujarati dish dhokla. Dhillon also revealed that Amit Shah had asked for his personal view on the government's decision, to which he had replied, "Agar itihaas likhna hai, toh kisi ko itihas banana padega" (we can write history only if we make history). Lt. General (R) Dhillon was heading the local army command in Kashmir when the landmark decision was taken by the Modi government in 2019.
item.itunes:title: 'Pak, Dhokla & 2 AM Call': Ex-Army Officer on Shah’s final Srinagar visit before 370 move

content:encoded.p: Union Home Minister Amit Shah's visit to Srinagar in June 2019 was intended to "put the finishing touches" on the government's determination to repeal Article 370. Inside details of Amit Shah's 370 Purge Plan have been revealed by Lt. Gen. (R) KJS Dhillon in his yet-to-be-released book, "Kitne Ghazi Aaye, Kitne Ghazi Gaye." Lt. Gen. (R) KJS Dhillon said that a lot of sensitive issues and key points were on the table for discussion, apart from the delectable food that included aloo paratha and the famous Gujarati dish dhokla. Dhillon also revealed that Amit Shah had asked for his personal view on the government's decision, to which he had replied, "Agar itihaas likhna hai, toh kisi ko itihas banana padega" (we can write history only if we make history). Lt. General (R) Dhillon was heading the local army command in Kashmir when the landmark decision was taken by the Modi government in 2019.

item.title: 'Strike London': Putin's ally calls for attack on UK after Sunak's fresh arms aid to Ukraine | Watch
item.description: A staunch ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin, Vladimir Solovyov, has called for striking the UK parliament while criticising the West for supporting Ukraine. "What's the problem with striking London?" asked Solovyov, who is a Russian state TV host. He called the UK, France, and Germany Nazi states united by hatred for everything Russian. The statement was made during a show on Moscow's state television, "Russia 1." Remember, Moscow has repeatedly accused London of provoking Kyiv with arms aid. The stunning remarks come days after Russia threatened a "bloody harvest" in war if the United Kingdom sent fighter jets to Ukraine's battlefield.
item.itunes:title: 'Strike London': Putin's ally calls for attack on UK after Sunak's fresh arms aid to Ukraine | Watch

content:encoded.p: A staunch ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin, Vladimir Solovyov, has called for striking the UK parliament while criticising the West for supporting Ukraine. "What's the problem with striking London?" asked Solovyov, who is a Russian state TV host. He called the UK, France, and Germany Nazi states united by hatred for everything Russian. The statement was made during a show on Moscow's state television, "Russia 1." Remember, Moscow has repeatedly accused London of provoking Kyiv with arms aid. The stunning remarks come days after Russia threatened a "bloody harvest" in war if the United Kingdom sent fighter jets to Ukraine's battlefield.

item.description: Indigenously developed Tapas-BH UAV captures Aero India 2023 rehearsal from 12,000 feet. The DRDO shared a stunning footage of Tapas UAV drone in action ahead of its debut. The 'Made In India' UAV will have its official debut during the air show in Bengaluru. Tapas is a medium altitude long endurance class unmanned aerial vehicle developed by DRDO. PM Narendra Modi retweeted the video of Tapas in action, captioning it as "very interesting."

item.title: Koshyari out, Ramesh Bais is the new governor of Maharashtra
item.description: The President of India has accepted the resignation of Bhagat Singh Koshyari as governor of Maharashtra. Ramesh Bais, governor of Jharkhand appointed as governor of Maharashtra. The above appointment will take effect from the dates they assume charge of their respective offices,” stated a press communique from Rashtrapati Bhavan

item.title: 4 arrested for duping Rohtak couple of ₹1.8 crore
item.description: “They made calls to the couple and lured them by promising high returns on their investment. The couple invested ₹1.81 crore hoping to get 10 times the amount. When accused did not contact the couple, they informed the police after which they were arrested,” a spokesman of Rohtak police said.

item.title: Meet Ramesh Bais, the new governor of Maharashtra
item.description: Bais started his political career by being elected as a councillor from Raipur Municipal Corporation in 1978 for the first time. Within two years, he was elected as an MLA from Mandir Hasod Constituency. In 1989, he successfully contested the Lok Sabha polls and continued to work as a parliamentarian till 2019. Born on August 2, 1947, Bais was the governor of Tripura before assuming the new role in the eastern state

item.title: Journalist killed in Ratnagiri: State announces ₹25 lakh compensation to family

item.title: 1972 batch of Sir JJ Hospital helps restore miniature model of its heritage building
item.description: The original model was prepared by Late Bagaji Mhatre. The foundation stone of Sir JJ Hospital was laid on January 3, 1843, and its inauguration took place on May 15, 1845. Dr Shrinivas Shanbag, the 1972 batch alumnus who coordinated the restoration work of the miniature model, said they wanted to give back something to the institution as they celebrated 50 years of passing out

It also comes hours after a U.S. F-22 Raptor fighter jet shot down a third object in North American airspace over Canada. Watch this video for more details.

item.title: Cities transforming India’s economy: Puri
item.description: Addressing the session on ‘Re-imagining Cities as Growth Centres for New Uttar Pradesh’ on the last day of the Uttar Pradesh Global Investors’ Summit, Union minister minister Hardeep Singh Puri recalled his old association with Lucknow and said: “I continue to visit the city every second or third month. The previous government had little interest in implementing the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana, which was launched by the Central government in June 2015. Only 17,000 homes could be built under the programme in 17 months, in the largest state in the nation.”
item.itunes:title: Cities transforming India’s economy: Puri

item.title: India can play a key role in climate cooperation
item.description: India took on a key position on the world stage by assuming the presidency of G20. This year, India will aim to provide leadership to a group of countries that comprises 85% of the world’s GDP and 60% of its population. Doing so will require determination, vision and courage. Today, Navroz K Dubash writes that India must use its presidency to push for greater cooperation to combat complex climate issues

item.title: Imran Khan calls Pak Army ‘negligent’ for spike in TTP terror attacks across country
item.description: Ex-Pak pm Imran khan has blamed his own country’s security forces for rising terrorism. Khan made these remarks during an interview with Voice of America. Watch this video for more.

item.title: Pak betrays Putin, sends rockets to Ukraine while seeking Russian oil | Report
item.description: Pakistan has reportedly sent 10,000 rockets to Ukraine to be used in Grad rocket launchers in war against Russia. A report in the Economic Times noted that the shipment left Karachi Port last month and will arrive in Germany via Poland. The weapons will be then transferred to Ukraine. This comes at a time when the cash-strapped nation is looking to secure a deal with Russia for oil supplies. On the other hand, Russia is keeping a close watch on Pakistan's weapons movement. Watch this video for more information.
item.itunes:title: Pak betrays Putin, sends rockets to Ukraine while seeking Russian oil | Report

A report in the Economic Times noted that the shipment left Karachi Port last month and will arrive in Germany via Poland. The weapons will be then transferred to Ukraine. This comes at a time when the cash-strapped nation is looking to secure a deal with Russia for oil supplies. On the other hand, Russia is keeping a close watch on Pakistan's weapons movement. Watch this video for more information.
